verses.kjv: And Job answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded:

verses.kjv: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
verses.ct: "Oh sure, you are the only ones who matter, and when you die, wisdom will disappear from the earth.

verses.kjv: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
verses.ct: But I have intelligence just like you do; I'm not less capable than you are. Who doesn't already know these things?

verses.kjv: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.
verses.ct: I've become a joke to my friends — someone who called out to God and received an answer, yet now a righteous and blameless man is ridiculed.

verses.kjv: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
verses.ct: Those who are comfortable have nothing but contempt for misfortune — ready to push someone who is already stumbling.

verses.kjv: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the tents of thieves are undisturbed, and those who provoke God live in safety — people to whom God has given abundantly.

verses.kjv: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
verses.ct: Just ask the animals, and they will instruct you; ask the birds of the sky, and they will inform you.

verses.kjv: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
verses.ct: Or talk to the earth, and it will teach you; the fish of the sea will explain it to you.

verses.kjv: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?
verses.ct: Which of all these creatures doesn't recognize that the LORD's hand has done this?

verses.kjv: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
verses.ct: The soul of every living creature is in his hand, along with the breath of every human being.

verses.kjv: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
verses.ct: Doesn't the ear evaluate words the same way the tongue tastes food?

verses.kjv: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
verses.ct: The elderly possess wisdom, and long life brings understanding.

verses.kjv: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
verses.ct: But true wisdom and power belong to God; counsel and understanding are his.

verses.kjv: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
verses.ct: When he tears something down, no one can rebuild it. When he imprisons someone, no one can set them free.

verses.kjv: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
verses.ct: When he holds back the waters, drought comes. When he releases them, they flood the earth.

verses.kjv: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
verses.ct: Strength and wisdom belong to him; both the deceived and the deceiver are under his control.

verses.kjv: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
verses.ct: He strips advisors of their wisdom and turns judges into fools.

verses.kjv: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
verses.ct: He removes the authority of kings and binds them with ropes around their waists.

verses.kjv: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
verses.ct: He leads priests away humiliated and brings down those who are firmly established.

verses.kjv: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
verses.ct: He silences the speech of trusted advisors and strips elders of their discernment.

verses.kjv: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
verses.ct: He heaps disgrace on nobles and disarms the powerful.

verses.kjv: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
verses.ct: He reveals profound things hidden in darkness and brings deep shadows into the light.

verses.kjv: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.
verses.ct: He causes nations to expand, then destroys them; he makes nations grow large, then scatters them.

verses.kjv: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
verses.ct: He strips the leaders of the earth of their judgment and sends them wandering through a trackless wasteland.

verses.kjv: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
verses.ct: They stumble around in darkness with no light, and he makes them stagger like drunkards."
